description: The defending NBA champions have been hit by injury.
title: LeBron James effort in vain as Cleveland Cavaliers fall to Detroit Pistons
title_page: LeBron James effort in vain as Cleveland Cavaliers fall to Detroit Pistons | Daily Mail Online
text:
LeBron James scored 29 points but the Cleveland Cavaliers still fell to a third successive NBA defeat as the Detroit Pistons won 106-101.
Andre Drummond top-scored for Detroit with 20 points as the Pistons returned to winning ways.
The injury-plagued Cavaliers remain top of the Eastern Conference standings but the defending NBA champions have the Boston Celtics hot on their heels.
Cleveland Cavaliers
STATS:
Reggie: 21 pts, 5 asts
Dre: 20 pts, 16 rbs
Tobias: 15 pts, 9 rbs
KCP: 15 pts
Ish: 12 pts
Marcus: 12 pts, 5 rbs pic.twitter.com/oNClXzh9pd — Detroit Pistons (@DetroitPistons) March 10, 2017
The San Antonio Spurs were denied a 10th straight win as Russell Westbrook inspired the Oklahoma City Thunder to a 102-92 victory.
Westbrook had his 31st triple-double of the season which also helped to end the Thunder’s own four-game losing streak.
Make it 31 triple-doubles for #RussellWestbrook. Ties Wilt for 2nd most in any season, ever. #NBA history. pic.twitter.com/175E51hoFi — OKC THUNDER (@okcthunder) March 10, 2017
The Los Angeles Lakers ended an eight-game losing sequence to beat the Phoenix Suns 122-110.
HIGHLIGHTS: Six Lakers score in double-figures tonight as they down the Suns, 122-110. #LakersWin pic.twitter.com/rX7DlvKLIp — Los Angeles Lakers (@Lakers) March 10, 2017
D’Angelo Russell racked up 23 points for the Lakers and TJ Warren top-scored for Phoenix with 17.
Elsewhere, the Portland Trail Blazers overcame the Philadelphia 76ers 114-108 after overtime and Austin Rivers scored 20 points as the Los Angeles Clippers comfortably beat the Memphis Grizzlies 114-98.
